cont.entity_a: Sound quality is generally good with some users noting excellent audio performance.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality is clear but not high fidelity, suitable for interviews and casual listening.

cont.entity_a: Longevity is a common issue, with many users experiencing malfunctioning speakers within a year.
The headphones have a high clamping force, causing discomfort during prolonged use.
cont.entity_b: Comfort is lacking, with headphones causing pain and sweating over long periods.

cont.entity_a: Noise cancellation is effective, blocking out external sounds well.
The coiled cord is heavy and awkward, often causing inconvenience during use.
cont.entity_b: Cord length is long, which can be both convenient and cumbersome.

cont.entity_a: Build quality is inconsistent, with some users experiencing quick wear and tear.
cont.entity_b: Build quality feels cheap and brittle, leading to potential durability issues.

cont.entity_a: Durability issues are noted, with parts breaking or malfunctioning prematurely.
cont.entity_b: The headphones are sturdy but have a tendency to break after extended use.

cont.entity_a: Sound isolation is decent but not as effective as expected for certain uses.
cont.entity_b: Noise isolation is moderate, not entirely blocking external sounds.

cont.entity_a: Bass quality is satisfactory but may not suit those seeking heavy bass.

cont.entity_b: Volume control on the headphones is a beneficial feature.
Headphones are collapsible for easy transport.
Some users experience issues with headphone jacks not fitting tightly.
